title: Temperature Control + RAG Prompting
description: LLM parameters (temperature, top-p), retrieval-augmented generation basics, and context injection

criteria.name: Correctness
criteria.description: Proper temperature usage, functional RAG implementation, accurate retrieval and context injection.

excellent.description: Perfect understanding of temperature effects. RAG system retrieves and uses context accurately. All components work together seamlessly.

good.description: Good temperature control demonstrated. RAG mostly functional. Context injection works well with minor issues.

satisfactory.description: Basic temperature usage. RAG partially functional. Context injection needs improvement.

poor.description: Misunderstanding of temperature parameter. RAG doesn't work properly. Context injection fails.

criteria.name: Code Quality
criteria.description: RAG system architecture, retrieval logic, and context management code quality.

excellent.description: Excellent RAG architecture. Efficient retrieval implementation. Clean context management. Proper handling of embeddings/vectors.

good.description: Good RAG structure. Functional retrieval logic. Decent context management. Minor efficiency issues.

satisfactory.description: Basic RAG implementation. Retrieval works but inefficient. Simple context handling.

poor.description: Poor RAG design. Inefficient or broken retrieval. No proper context management.

criteria.name: Documentation
criteria.description: Explanation of parameter choices, RAG system design, and retrieval strategy.

excellent.description: Comprehensive documentation. Temperature choices justified. RAG architecture clearly explained. Retrieval strategy well-documented.

good.description: Good documentation. Most parameters explained. RAG design documented. Retrieval logic described.

satisfactory.description: Basic documentation. Some parameter justification. Limited RAG documentation.

poor.description: Minimal documentation. No parameter justification. RAG system unexplained.

criteria.name: Creativity
criteria.description: Creative use of temperature, innovative retrieval strategies, novel context injection approaches.

excellent.description: Innovative temperature experimentation. Creative retrieval strategies. Novel context injection techniques.

good.description: Interesting parameter experiments. Good retrieval approach. Creative context usage.

satisfactory.description: Standard parameter usage. Basic retrieval. Conventional context injection.

poor.description: No experimentation. Direct copying of examples. No original thinking.

allowedTools: GitHub Copilot for code completion and syntax
Stack Overflow for retrieval algorithms and embeddings
Documentation for vector databases and embedding models
prohibited: Using AI to generate complete RAG implementations
aiUsagePolicy.guidelines: Use AI for syntax help, but RAG system design and retrieval strategy must demonstrate your own understanding.

deliverables: Python file (practical3.py) with temperature experiments and RAG implementation
Comparison showing temperature effects (0.0, 0.5, 1.0, 1.5) on same prompt
Simple RAG system with document storage and retrieval
README.md explaining parameter choices and RAG architecture
learningObjectives: Understand and control LLM temperature and sampling parameters
Manage context injection and prompt construction with retrieved data
Compare deterministic vs. creative outputs using parameter tuning
